ns0:foreignObject.html:div: Move one square in any direction, and test AGL with DC 3. On a failure, gain the 'prone' card. On success, you may set your facing to any direction. Double the DC of the above check to move two squares in a straight line
movement

Move one square in any direction.
Return this card to your hand
movement

You may return this card to your pool and replace with the any 'basic attack' card.
Target: One square within reach 1 or your own square
Choose one of:
Deal (1d4 - 2 + STR/2) damage.
Enemy must make a DC (STR-2) STR or AGL check. On failure, they move one square away from or towards you, your choice. Remember that, if a character moves into another character's square for any reason, if either character desires, both characters gain opposed 'grappling' cards
Same check as above, but on failure, they gain the 'prone' effect

strike
unarmed
basic attack

Move one square in any direction.
Return this card to your hand
movement

You may return this card to your pool and replace with the any 'basic attack' card.
Target: One square within reach 1 or your own square
Choose two of:
Deal (TEC adv: 1d4 + STR/2 +1) damage.
Enemy must make a DC (MAX(STR, TEC) + EMP/2) STR or AGL check. On failure, they move one square away from or towards you, your choice. Remember that, if a character moves into another character's square for any reason, if either character desires, both characters gain opposed 'grappling' cards
Same check as above, but on failure, they gain the 'prone' effect

strike
unarmed
basic attack

You may return this card to your pool and replace with the any 'basic attack' card.
Target: One square within reach 1 or your own square
Choose two of:
Deal (TEC adv: 1d4 + STR/2 +1) damage.
Enemy must make a DC (MAX(STR, TEC) + EMP/2) STR or AGL check. On failure, they move one square away from or towards you, your choice. Remember that, if a character moves into another character's square for any reason, if either character desires, both characters gain opposed 'grappling' cards
Same check as above, but on failure, they gain the 'prone' effect

basic attack

You may return this card to your pool and replace with the any 'basic attack' card.
Target: One square within reach 1 or your own square
Choose two of:
Deal (TEC adv: 1d4 + STR/2 +1) damage.
Enemy must make a DC (MAX(STR, TEC) + EMP/2) STR or AGL check. On failure, they move one square away from or towards you, your choice. Remember that, if a character moves into another character's square for any reason, if either character desires, both characters gain opposed 'grappling' cards
Same check as above, but on failure, they gain the 'prone' effect

strike
unarmed
basic attack

Choose one of:
Deal (TEC adv: 1d8 + STR/2) damage, targeting one square within reach 1 or your own square.
Deal (TEC -3 adv: 1d8 + STR/2, 1 on a die means 0 dmg) damage, targeting a line within reach STR * 4. Your dagger ends up at the end of the line or in the square of whatever you hit.

strike
precise
basic attack

Chose a 'strike' attack targeting your square or an adjacent square. Move one square toward the source of the attack. For the purposes of calculating the damage of that attack, subtract a total of your STR + TEC from whichever attributes of the attacker you see fit. Your attacker looses all their combo and cannot refresh this tick.
movement

Chose one of:
Move one square in any direction. Next action in this stack gains +1 priority.
Move two squares in a straight line, and test AGL with DC 4. On a failure, gain the 'prone' card.On a success, you may move a third space in the same direction.
Lose 2 priority on this card. Select any one non-area attack that is currently targeting your square. You are unaffected by it.
movement

Chose one of:
Move one square in any direction. Next action in this stack gains +1 priority.
Move two squares in a straight line, and test AGL with DC 4. On a failure, gain the 'prone' card.On a success, you may move a third space in the same direction.
Lose 2 priority on this card. Select any one non-area attack that is currently targeting your square. You are unaffected by it.
movement

Chose one of:
Move one square in any direction. Next action in this stack gains +1 priority.
Move two squares in a straight line, and test AGL with DC 4. On a failure, gain the 'prone' card.On a success, you may move a third space in the same direction.
Lose 2 priority on this card. Select any one non-area attack that is currently targeting your square. You are unaffected by it.
movement

Target: One creature that has, this tick, moved to your square or a square you are currently adjacent to.
Continue their movement one extra square (or two if the one would mean they end up in your square). They immedately lose all AP they currently have in play, and all cards they currently have on the field are discarded. They gain the 'prone' status

throw
strike

Move one square in any direction, and test AGL with DC 3. On a failure, gain the 'prone' card. On success, you may set your facing to any direction. Double the DC of the above check to move two squares in a straight line
movement

Move one square in any direction.
Return this card to your hand
movement

You may return this card to your pool and replace with the any 'basic attack' card.
Target: One square within reach 1 or your own square
Choose one of:
Deal (TEC adv: 1d4 + STR/2 +0) damage.
Enemy must make a DC (STR-2) STR or AGL check. On failure, they move one square away from or towards you, your choice. Remember that, if a character moves into another character's square for any reason, if either character desires, both characters gain opposed 'grappling' cards
Same check as above, but on failure, they gain the 'prone' effect

strike

basic attack

You may return this card to your pool and replace with the any 'basic attack' card.
Target: One square within reach 1 or your own square
Choose one of:
Deal (TEC adv: 1d4 + STR/2 +0) damage.
Enemy must make a DC (STR-2) STR or AGL check. On failure, they move one square away from or towards you, your choice. Remember that, if a character moves into another character's square for any reason, if either character desires, both characters gain opposed 'grappling' cards
Same check as above, but on failure, they gain the 'prone' effect

strike
unarmed
basic attack

Choose one of:
Deal TEC adv: 1d12 + STR/2 damage, targeting a line of three squares.
Deal TEC adv: 1d12 + STR/2 damage, targeting a cone of two squares.

strike
basic attack
Chose a 'strike' attack targeting your square or an adjacent square. Your weapon takes damage from the attack. If your weapon is destroyed, any leftover damage continues toward the original target

Bypass: 10
Gain DR 8. Reduce your AGL by 7 - STR.
Equipment

Move one square in any direction.
Return this card to your hand
movement

Chose one of:
Move one square in any direction. Next action in this stack gains +1 priority.
Move two squares in a straight line, and test AGL with DC 4. On a failure, gain the 'prone' card..
Lose 2 priority on this card. Select any one non-area attack that is currently targeting your square. You are unaffected by it.
movement

Target: One forward square
Deal 1d4 + STR - 1 damage. If you deal damage, you can latch on to your target. Gain the 'latched on' effect, while your target gains the 'chomped' effect

strike
unarmed

Move one square in any direction.
Return this card to your hand
movement

Chose one of:
Move one square in any direction. Next action in this stack gains +1 priority.
Move two squares in a straight line, and test AGL with DC 4. On a failure, gain the 'prone' card..
Lose 2 priority on this card. Select any one non-area attack that is currently targeting your square. You are unaffected by it.
movement

Target: One forward square
Deal 1d4 + STR - 1 damage. If you deal damage, you can latch on to your target. Gain the 'latched on' effect, while your target gains the 'chomped' effect

strike
unarmed

Target: One entity which you latched on to and have at least 10 tokens on
Deal STRd4 damage. Heal half the damage you dealt. If that would put you over maximum, gain 1/10th of the additional as permanent extra HP. Do not round -- extra bits add up over uses of this card

strike
unarmed
hunger

You may not use 'movement' cards that do not also have the 'prone' tag.
Can be removed by spending 2 AP
status
As long as this card is in effect, cannot use any 'movement' cards. This card may be turned into 'Grappling' if you have at least one bid token on it
status

As long as this card is in effect, any 'movement' cards you use have 0 combo, 1/2 priority, and affect both you and the person you are grappling. If you have at least one bid token on this card, you may chose to only affect yourself with movement cards. If you leave the square of the person you are grappling, discard this card.
You may turn this card's partner from 'Grappling' into 'Grappled' if you have at least your enemy's STR bid tokens on this card.
You may turn this card's partner from 'Grappled' into 'Pinned' if you have at least 2x your enemy's STR bid tokens on this card
status

As long as this card is in effect, cannot use any 'movement' or 'strike' cards. Your STR and TEC count as one lower for the purposes of bidding on this card. This card may be turned into 'Grappling' if you have at least one bid token on it
status

As long as this card is in effect, you may not use any 'movement' or 'strike' cards. You may voluntarily discard this card by paying 1 AP with priority TEC + 4. This card is discarded if its paired 'Chomped' card is discarded
status

As long as this card is in effect, all 'movement' cards take + 1 AP, and apply to both you and the creature that has chomped you. All 'strike' cards have -1 priority. Each time you activate a 'movement' or 'strike' card, take 1d4-1 damage. Can be removed if you have at least one bid token on this card
status
